newsitem.title: USA: DLJ unit plans brokerage PC workstation.
newsitem.headline: DLJ unit plans brokerage PC workstation.

text.p: Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette's Pershing unit Tuesday said it has selected Ernst and Young LLP, Microsoft Corp and Antares Alliance to build a computer workstation for the clearing industry.
Term of the deal were not disclosed.
Paradigm, the Pershing workstation, will integrate marketing and sales, customer servies, operations and accounting functions, the company said.

It will serve as the platform for the delivery of service to Pershing's more than 500 correspondent brokerage firms. Customer pilots of the the new workstation will begin later this year, with the installation planned for early 1998.
Ernst and Young will manage the project while microsoft and Antares will provide software.
Antares is a joint venture owned by Amdahl Corp and Electronic Data Systems Corp.
